Armored Kilt.name: Armored Kilt
Armored Kilt.description: An armored kilt can be worn with other armor, and turns light armor into medium armor, and medium armor into heavy armor.

Dancing Scarves.name: Dancing Scarves
Dancing Scarves.description: This set of colorful scarves is made of heavy silk and reinforced with leather straps. You only get their AC bonus if you move at least 10 feet during your turn, this lasts until your next turn.

Haramaki.name: Haramaki
Haramaki.description: Also called a belly-warmer, a haramaki is a simple silken sash lined with chainmail or articulated metal plates and tied about the stomach to protect it.

Padded.name: Padded
Padded.description: More than simple clothing, padded armor combines heavy, quilted cloth and layers of densely packed stuffing to create a cheap and basic protection.

Quilted Cloth.name: Quilted Cloth
Quilted Cloth.description: This enhanced form of padded armor has internal layers specifically designed to trap arrows, bolts, darts, shuriken, thrown daggers, and other small ranged piercing weapons. Wearing quilted cloth armor gives you DR 3/— against attacks of this kind.

Reinforced Tunic.name: Reinforced Tunic
Reinforced Tunic.description: Sometimes called a leine, this belted tunic has thick cords woven through it that cover vital areas. You also get a +2 to AC versus confirming critical hits.

Silken Ceremonial Armor.name: Silken Ceremonial Armor
Silken Ceremonial Armor.description: These robes consist of several layers of cloth and an outer layer of silk intricately woven with gold brocade designs and covered with metal studs.

Lamellar Cuirass.name: Lamellar Cuirass
Lamellar Cuirass.description: This armor consists of a light breastplate and shoulder guards made from lacquered leather plates bound together and fitted over a silk shirt.

Leather.name: Leather
Leather.description: Leather armor is made up of multiple overlapping pieces of leather, boiled to increase their natural toughness and then deliberately stitched together.

Rosewood Armor.name: Rosewood Armor
Rosewood Armor.description: This suit of leather armor is wrapped in special rose vines, granting it armor spikes. You must water the vines with a gallon of water each day to maintain the spikes.

Hell Knight Leather.name: Hell Knight Leather
Hell Knight Leather.description: This studded leather armor includes heavy gloves and a helm of sculpted leather designed to look like a skull-either a human’s or that of some aquatic creature.

Hide Shirt.name: Hide Shirt
Hide Shirt.description: Made from animal hide and giant lizard scales over a shirt of interwoven cords, these chest and shoulder coverings protect without restricting mobility.

Leaf Armor.name: Leaf Armor
Leaf Armor.description: Alchemically treated leaves have been sticthed together to make jerkins, bracers, and leggings.

Parade Armor.name: Parade Armor
Parade Armor.description: A showy noncombat uniform that grants a +2 circumstance bonus on Diplomacy and Intimidat checks to influence someone from the uniform's country or region.

Spider-Silk Bodysuit.name: Spider-Silk Bodysuit
Spider-Silk Bodysuit.description: This exotic form-fitting garment is woven entirely from alchemically treated silk harvested from giant spiders or other arachnid creatures.

Studded Leather.name: Studded Leather
Studded Leather.description: An improved form of leather armor, studded leather armor is covered with dozens of metal protuberances.

Wooden.name: Wooden
Wooden.description: This suit of leather armor has plates of fire-treated wood sewn over vital areas, and the wood is slightly bouyant, the armor check penalty for swimming in this armor is 0.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Covering the torso, this shirt is made up of thousands of interlocking metal rings.

Lamellar (Leather).name: Lamellar (Leather)
Lamellar (Leather).description: Lamellar is a type of armor in which small plates of various types of materials are strung together in parallel rows using fine cord.

Armored Coat.name: Armored Coat
Armored Coat.description: This sturdy leather coat is reinforced with metal plates sewn into the lining. You may don or remove the coat as a move action.

Chain Coat.name: Chain Coat
Chain Coat.description: This relatively simple armor consists of heavy chains that wrap around your body and limbs, and you may affix a spiked chain to each hand, to use as weapons.

Hide.name: Hide
Hide.description: Hide armor is made from the tanned skin of particularly thick-hided beasts, stitched with either multiple overlapping layers of crude leather or exterior pieces of leather stuffed with padding or fur.

Ice Coat.name: Ice Coat
Ice Coat.description: Used by natives to the arctic tundra, this heavy parka is treated as an armored coat. It provides the benefits of a cold-weather outfit, grants a +2 circumstance bonus to stealth in snow, and it can be donned or removed as a move action.

Do-Maru.name: Do-Maru
Do-Maru.description: It consists primarily of lamellar and lacks a solid breastplate or sleeves, leaving the shoulders and upper body somewhat exposed, but permitting the wearer greater flexibility than do the majority of heavier armors.

Kikko Armor.name: Kikko Armor
Kikko Armor.description: Kikko armor consists of a clever arrangement of hexagonal plates made from iron and sewn to cloth, granting the wearer greater  flexibility than that provided by many armors that afford similar defense.

Lamellar (Horn).name: Lamellar (Horn)
Lamellar (Horn).description: Lamellar is a type of armor in which small plates of various types of materials are strung together in parallel rows using fine cord.

Scale Mail.name: Scale Mail
Scale Mail.description: Scale mail is made up of dozens of small, overlapping metal plates and includes a pair of gauntlets.

Breaastplate.name: Breastplate
Breaastplate.description: A breastplate protects a wearer’s torso with a single piece of sculpted metal, similar to the core piece of a suit of full plate.

Agile Breastplate.name: Agile Breastplate
Agile Breastplate.description: This breastplate is specially crafted in a manner that allows extra maneuverability, the armor check penalty for Climb and Acrobatics checks made to jump is only –1.

Chainmail.name: Chainmail
Chainmail.description: Chainmail protects the wearer with a complete mesh of chain links that cover the torso and arms, and extends below the waist. The suit includes gauntlets.

Four-Mirror Armor.name: Four-Mirror Armor
Four-Mirror Armor.description: This armor consists of four plates harnessed together with leather shoulder straps, and comes with a spiked helmet with a chainmail hood.

Lamellar (Steel).name: Lamellar (Steel)
Lamellar (Steel).description: Lamellar is a type of armor in which small plates of various types of materials are strung together in parallel rows using fine cord.

Mountain Pattern Armor.name: Mountain Pattern Armor
Mountain Pattern Armor.description: This medium armor consists of hundreds of small, interlocking pieces of steel shaped to resemble an ancient symbol for the word mountain.

Banded Mail.name: Banded Mail
Banded Mail.description: Banded mail is made up of overlapping strips of metal, fastened to a sturdy backing of leather and chain.

Field Plate.name: Field Plate
Field Plate.description: This heavy armor is similar to full plate but lighter in construction, sacrificing a bit of protection for greater flexibility and mobility.

Kusari Gusoku.name: Kusari Gusoku
Kusari Gusoku.description: This armor has a chain jacket, arm, shoulder, and thigh guards, and either an armored hood or kabuto helmet.

Lamellar (Iron).name: Lamellar (Iron)
Lamellar (Iron).description: Lamellar is a type of armor in which small plates of various types of materials are strung together in parallel rows using fine cord.

Splint Mail.name: Splint Mail
Splint Mail.description: Splint mail is made up of overlapping layers of metal strips attached to a backing of leather or sturdy fabric, and includes gauntlets.

Tatami-Do.name: Tatami-Do
Tatami-Do.description: Tatami-do is a full-body field armor that combines both metal lamellar and kikko components into a suit of mail with a cloth backing.

Fortress Plate.name: Fortress Plate
Fortress Plate.description: Fortress plate is incredibly bulky, and its armor category can’t be reduced by any effect (including by special materials, such as mithral), it also includes gauntlets and a helm.

Half-Plate.name: Half-Plate
Half-Plate.description: Half-plate armor combines elements of full plate and chainmail, incorporating several sizable plates of sculpted metal with an underlying mesh of chain links. Half-plate armor includes gauntlets and a helm.

Agile Half-Plate.name: Agile Half-Plate
Agile Half-Plate.description: This style of half-plate is specially crafted in a manner that allows extra maneuverability for some physical activities. Climb checks are made at only a -4, and you can still run ad x4 speed.

Hell Knight Half-Plate.name: Hell Knight Half-Plate
Hell Knight Half-Plate.description: The armor worn by a Hell Knight signifer is a vestment of armored plates, chain, and dark fabric. It includes a signifier mask and can be donned and removed as medium armor.

Lamellar (Stone Coat).name: Lamellar (Stone Coat)
Lamellar (Stone Coat).description: Lamellar is a type of armor in which small plates of various types of materials are strung together in parallel rows using fine cord.

O-Yoroi.name: O-Yoroi
O-Yoroi.description: Worn almost exclusively by highranking samurai, o-yoroi—or “great armor”—is a heavy combat armor that consists of various supplementary components that include both plate and lamellar elements.

Full Plate.name: Full Plate
Full Plate.description: A complete suit of full plate (or platemail, as it is often called) includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and a thick layer of padding that is worn underneath the armor. Each suit of full plate must be individually fitted to its owner by a master armorsmith, although a captured suit can be resized to fit a new owner at a cost of 200 to 800 (2d4 x 100) gold pieces.

weapons.name: Unarmed Strike
weapons.description: Just a punch or slap of the hand.

weapons.name: Gauntlet
weapons.description: A metal glove that lets you deal lethal damage with unarmed strikes. Medium and heavy armors (except breastplate) come with gauntlets.

weapons.name: Battle Aspergillum
weapons.description: Named for the common aspergillum, a mace-like tool used by priests to sprinkle holy water, this light mace has a hollow head and a metal plug to fit the hollow’s neck.

weapons.name: Brass Knife
weapons.description: Though brass doesn’t hold as sharp an edge as steel, it isn’t vulnerable to rust like steel is.

weapons.name: Brass Knuckles
weapons.description: These close combat weapons are designed to fit comfortably around the knuckles, narrowing the contact area and therefore magnifying the amount of force delivered by a punch.

weapons.name: Cestus
weapons.description: The cestus is a glove of leather or thick cloth that covers the wielder from mid-finger to mid-forearm, ofen reinforced with metal plates over the fingers.

weapons.name: Dagger
weapons.description: A dagger has a blade that is about 1 foot in length.

weapons.name: Punching Dagger
weapons.description: A punching dagger’s blade is attached to a horizontal handle that projects out from the fist when held.

weapons.name: Spiked Gauntlet
weapons.description: An attack with a spiked gauntlet is considered an armed attack, and the cost and weight given are for a single gauntlet.

weapons.name: Traveling Kettle
weapons.description: These small tea kettles are made with clamping lids and heavily reinforced handles.

weapons.name: Hook Hand
weapons.description: Pirates who lose a hand in the course of their adventures sometimes attach hooks to their wrists.

weapons.name: Kunai
weapons.description: Crafted from a single piece of iron, a kunai has a leaf-shaped blade and a ring for a pommel. Adapted from the common trowel, the kunai has a thick blade that is sharpened only near the tip.

weapons.name: Light Mace
weapons.description: A light mace is made up of an ornate metal head attached to a simple wooden or metal shaft.

weapons.name: Sickle
weapons.description: A curved blade extends from the basic wooden handle, though usable in a pinch the sickle is mainly a farming tool.

weapons.name: Spring Blade
weapons.description: This 4-inch blade is attached via a hinge to a wooden handle with a slot in the center, into which the blade can be folded. With a click of a switch, a spring thrusts the blade outward, where it locks into place until it is reset.

weapons.name: Wodden Stake
weapons.description: This close combat weapon is just a sharpened piece of wood. Iron spikes used as weapons deal damage as wooden stakes.

weapons.name: Club
weapons.description: This weapon is usually just a shaped piece of wood, sometimes with a few nails or studs embedded in it.

weapons.name: Mere Club
weapons.description: Traditionally made of carved stone, the mere (MEH-reh) is a short, flat-sided, sharp-pointed club.

weapons.name: Heavy Mace
weapons.description: A heavy mace has a larger head and a longer handle than a normal (light) mace.

weapons.name: Morningstar
weapons.description: A morningstar is a spiked metal ball, affixed to the top of a long handle.

weapons.name: Shortspear
weapons.description: A shortspear is about 3 feet in length, making it a suitable thrown weapon.

weapons.name: Bayonet
weapons.description: Bayonets are close combat weapons designed to fit into the grooves or muzzles of crossbows and firearms.

weapons.name: Boarding Pike
weapons.description: A boarding pike is an 8-foot-long pole topped with a foot-long tapered metal tip.

weapons.name: Kumade
weapons.description: Adapted from a garden rake, the kumade consists of a wood or bamboo pole topped with a metal claw. The rake head doubles as a grappling hook.

weapons.name: Collapsible Kumade
weapons.description: This weapon acts as a kumade, but the handle consists of bamboo sections held together by a taut rope running through the center.

weapons.name: Lantern Staff
weapons.description: This long metal staff has reservoirs for lamp oil, and a lantern-like structure at its head.

weapons.name: Longspear
weapons.description: A longspear is about 8 feet in length.

weapons.name: Quarterstaff
weapons.description: A quarterstaff is a simple piece of wood, about 5 feet in length.

weapons.name: Spear
weapons.description: A spear is 5 feet in length and can be thrown.

weapons.name: Boar Spear
weapons.description: This spear with a spiraling blade has a metal crossbar approximately halfway down its length.

weapons.name: Weighted Spear
weapons.description: This pole has a spear head at one end and a mace head at the other. It can be wielded like a standard spear (though it isn’t balanced for throwing), or it can be used as a double weapon, alternately thrusting and bashing.

weapons.name: Blowgun
weapons.description: Blowguns are generally used to deliver debilitating (but rarely fatal) poisons from a distance. They are nearly silent when fired.

weapons.name: Heavy Crossbow
weapons.description: You draw a Heavy Crossbow back by truning a small winch, this takes a full-round action that provkes Attacks of Opportunity

weapons.name: Heavy Crossbow (Underwater)
weapons.description: An Underwater Crossbow functions as a regular crossbow above water.

weapons.name: Light Crossbow
weapons.description: You draw a Light Crossbow back by pulling a lever, this takes a move action that provokes Attacks of Opportunity.

weapons.name: Light Crossbow (Underwater)
weapons.description: An Underwater Crossbow functions as a regular crossbow above water.

weapons.name: Javelin
weapons.description: A javelin is a thin throwing spear.

weapons.name: Sling
weapons.description: A sling is little more than a leather cup attached to a pair of strings.

weapons.name: Stingchuck
weapons.description: A stingchuck is a foul bag made of a humanoid’s head with the brain removed and the skull heavily scored so that it bursts open when thrown.

weapons.name: Stonebow
weapons.description: A stonebow, or bullet crossbow, resembles a light crossbow except for the distinct U-shaped bend in the stock.

weapons.name: Throwing Darts
weapons.description: Darts are missile weapons, designed to fly such that a sharp, often weighted point will strike first.

weapons.name: Crossbow Bolts
weapons.description: These bolts come in a case or quiver that holds 10 bolts. You may stab with the bolt as a Light Improvised Weapon (-4 to hit) using the damage given.

weapons.name: Crossbow Bolts, Acid
weapons.description: These metal bolts have a glass section in the middle, filled with acid.

weapons.name: Crossbow Bolts, Drow Poison
weapons.description: These bolts have a strange tip that delivers the poison, but also affects accuracy. Double the range penalties for this bolt.

weapons.name: Crossbow Bolts, Fire
weapons.description: These metal bolts have a glass section in the middle, filled with a alchemical fire.

weapons.name: Sling Bullets
weapons.description: These bullets come in a leather pouch that holds 10 bullets.

weapons.name: Sling Bullets, Groaning
weapons.description: These sling bullets are honeycombed with overlapping perforations that cause them to emit an eerie moan audible within 500 feet of their flight path.

weapons.name: Sling Bullets, Smoke
weapons.description: Uses a touch attack to release noxious smoke (DC 13 Fort), nauseating target for 2 rounds.

weapons.name: Blowgun Darts
weapons.description: These light darts have tiny grooves behind the tips. A character can apply poison to a blowgun dart without risk of poisoning himself.
